alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 6:13PM EDT until July 21 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY... At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the warning area. There are numerous reports of street flooding throughout the city of Nashua. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nashua, Hollis, Hudson, Pelham, Londonderry and Windham. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
